title: Tuza's Conjecture for Graphs with Maximum Average Degree Less Than 7
main_result: Tuza holds for max average degree < 7

lemmas.name: tuza_mad_lt_7
lemmas.statement: theorem tuza_mad_lt_7 (G : SimpleGraph V) (h : maxAvgDegree G < 7) : triangleCoveringNumber G ≤ 2 * trianglePackingNumber G
lemmas.english: Graphs with maximum average degree < 7 satisfy Tuza

lemmas.name: reducible_set_definition
lemmas.statement: A set S of edges is reducible if: for all graphs G, if τ(G \ S) ≤ 2ν(G \ S) and certain structural conditions hold, then τ(G) ≤ 2ν(G)
lemmas.english: Reducible sets cannot appear in minimal counterexamples
implications: Core technique for proving special cases

lemmas.name: discharging_lemma
lemmas.statement: If G has mad < 7 and is a minimal counterexample, then discharging argument reaches contradiction
lemmas.english: Discharging proves no minimal counterexample has mad < 7

key_insight: Reducible sets + discharging method. A nu=4 counterexample must have maximum average degree >= 7.
notes: Reducible sets technique could be formalized for future work
